PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: MONTH OF THE YEAR EFFECT IN STOCK MARKET
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: The January effect is a hypothesis that there is a seasonal anomaly in the financial market where securities' prices increase in the month of January more than in any other month. This calendar effect would create an opportunity for investors to buy stocks for lower prices before January and sell them after their value increases. As with all calendar effects, if true, it would suggest that the market is not efficient, as market efficiency would suggest that this effect should disappear
